newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA corn export sales highlights in latest reporting week:

Net sales of 263,900 MT fell 45 percent from the previous week and the 4-week average. Major increases reported for Spain (99,200 MT), Taiwan (60,600 MT), Indonesia (55,000 MT), the Dominican Republic (42,900 MT), and Morocco (29,300 MT) were partially offset by decreases for unknown destinations (45,800 MT), Italy (30,000 MT), Japan (25,900 MT), and Colombia (19,800 MT).
Sales of 490,200 MT for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year were primarily for Taiwan (164,900 MT), Japan (111,400 MT), South Korea (104,600 MT), and unknown destinations (52,500 MT).

Exports of 641,200 MT equaled the week earlier and the 4-week average. The primary recipients were Japan (188,100 MT), Taiwan (115,000 MT), South Korea (52,700 MT), Spain (41,700 MT), the Dominican Republic (39,900 MT), and Colombia (33,600 MT).
